title: Mission Description
content: Krateros brought word of Aglaea's death, and the Garmentmaker's message that followed confirmed it, I was stunned. After shaking off the "Cleaners," I returned to Okhema at once. Upon reuniting with (Trailblazer), I sought out our companions to learn what had happened...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: These folks in black...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Are not responding to provocations, nor do they seem intent on fighting. What exactly are they waiting for?

speaker: Lygus
line: Pressure. Fear. Planting seeds of anxiety. It seems this is the strategy they've chosen.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: An organization that sees it as their mission to eradicate the Chrysos Heirs...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I've read some chilling accounts — stories of the "Cleaners" using alchemical arts to implant fragments of memories into their successors, ensuring both identity and hatred live on.

speaker: Lygus
line: From what I know, these stories are true. The Caenis we know today — strictly speaking — is the 27th Caenis.

speaker: Lygus
line: Objectively, the rise of the Cleaners was both inevitable and necessary. Yet, their ruthless and twisted methods earned them nothing but disdain and condemnation from history.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: And still, they endure. An organization persisting through time, now working tirelessly to obstruct the Flame-Chase.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Are they truly so terrified of the "Era Nova" the Chrysos Heirs strive for?

speaker: Lygus
line: Even in these crumbling end times, there are always those who find ways to profit from the chaos.

speaker: Lygus
line: To ask the vested interests to abandon their status, wealth, and ambitions in this world for a distant ideal, may be no easier than creating a miracle.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ ...I wonder where (Trailblazer) is now. If they're targeting me, ( he / she ) definitely won't escape their notice either. I hope all is well...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is that... Lord Krateros?

speaker: Krateros
line: ▶ There you are, Lord Dan Heng. We couldn't reach you on the teleslate, so the Holy City Guard almost assumed you and (Trailblazer) had met some terrible fate.

speaker: Krateros
line: You pests crawling in the shadows, back off! Your plot ends here.

speaker: Krateros
line: You've played your hand. Run while you still can. It might be your only chance to survive.

speaker: Krateros
line: Stay away from Okhema forever. If you set foot there again, the fury of its people will tear you apart.

speaker: Krateros
line: Because Aglaea is dead, and in the eyes of the holy city's citizens, her blood is on your hands!

speaker: "Cleaner" Captain
line: Hehe...

speaker: "Cleaner" Captain
line: Looks like she was wrong about you.

speaker: Phainon
line: She...? Are you talking about the mastermind behind all of this?

speaker: "Cleaner" Captain
line: She thought you were weak. She believed that even when facing the "evil" you claim to oppose, you'd hesitate to strike.

speaker: Phainon
line: Misinterpreting mercy for weakness shows how arrogant and foolish your master is.

speaker: Phainon
line: They're still alive. With proper care, they'll pull through in a few days.

speaker: Phainon
line: But I must warn you — I haven't fought a human in ages. I can't guarantee I'll always be able to hold back. They're lucky they're still alive...

speaker: Phainon
line: If you feel as lucky as they are, try me.

text: Bro, you sound kind of scary.

speaker: Mem
line: Phainon is seriously upset...

speaker: Phainon
line: Get out of here. Don't show your face around us again. If your master wants to stop the Flame-Chase Journey, she'd better bring an army that makes Kremnos at its peak look like child's play.

speaker: "Cleaner" Captain
line: I've said it more than once, Lord Phainon... we're not here to start a fight.

speaker: "Cleaner" Captain
line: We came only to ensure you weren't anywhere else.

speaker: "Cleaner" Captain
line: While you were unaware, we already accomplished our mission — to buy time.

speaker: "Cleaner" Captain
line: So, Lord Phainon... until next time.

speaker: Mem
line: Are you okay?

speaker: Phainon
line: I'm fine. Anyone who uses innocent lives as bargaining chips has gone too far.

text: But they were after the Chrysos Heirs.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hmm. I guess, the opposition within the Council of Elders is still desperately fighting to obstruct the Flame-Chase.

text: Do they think they have a chance?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Probably a desperate gamble... I guess, the opposition within the Council of Elders is still desperately fighting to obstruct the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Phainon
line: If the conspiracy is exposed, they'll be hunted down in the holy city like rats with nowhere to run. No matter where they hide...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...My teleslate?

text: Messages Urgent This message was automatically sent by the system Garmentmaker Global Announcement: Due to force majeure, the World Wound Web operations will be temporarily suspended. Please stay calm and remain in your homes. What's going on? (Trailblazer) What's going on? ??? (Trailblazer) ??? Message failed to send. You are not currently in the service area. Please try again later —Whitelist Protocol Loaded— Garmentmaker Local golden thread enabled for emergency internal communication only. Lady Goldweaver deceased. Please return to the holy city at once. Hyacine I know it's hard to believe, but... Please come back soon Dan Heng On my way

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea!? Is this —

speaker: Phainon
line: Blast it! Those guys...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I've heard from more than one person. It doesn't seem like a joke.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: But how could they possibly...

speaker: Phainon
line: Stay calm... this could just be one of her schemes. I won't believe it until I see it for myself...

speaker: Mem
line: Phainon...

speaker: Mem
line: What should we do now?

speaker: Phainon
line: Stay on course. I'll contact Tribbie and ask her to keep the citizens calm. We'll hurry back to Okhema as fast as possible and assess the situation in the city. If we run into any enemies along the way...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I won't be merciful this time.
"...Chartonus."

speaker: Chartonus
line: Mmm...?

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "You're forging a sword for Phainon, aren't you?"

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "I haven't seen you wield the hammer in so long... I couldn't help but be entranced by the sight."

speaker: Chartonus
line: You... Aglaea.

speaker: Chartonus
line: In this form, you come to me. It means...

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "That's right. At this moment, my physical form is already shattered. My journey as a human in this world has come to an end. "

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "It's time to fulfill our pact."

speaker: Chartonus
line: Of course... The pact, I haven't forgotten.

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "The thing I entrusted to you, do you still have it?"

speaker: Chartonus
line: Far too plain, this vessel is... Not worthy of you. Do you still insist?

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "I insist."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "Over the past thousand years, every piece of fabric I've worked with has been tainted by my cold divinity. It's made me hate their colors, texture, and scent."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "This ornament stands apart... It was a gift from a child. She was pure and kind. I often wished my childhood could have been like hers."

speaker: Chartonus
line: How to say goodbye to everyone... have you already planned?

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "I'm afraid there's no such detailed plan this time. I deeply regret not being able to say farewell to them one by one."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "The moment has come... My departure will give them one less thing to worry about. This parting gift should help ease the regret of such a sudden goodbye."

speaker: Chartonus
line: Invented for the Titans, Kremnos's Soul-Forging technology was. Though divinity it retains, filtered out, the remnants of humanity will be.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Is that what you want, Aglaea?

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "You've confirmed this with me repeatedly. Yes, Chartonus, I need you to do this for me."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "Condense my divinity into this ornament... It might still be useful in the future to help them complete their mission."

speaker: Chartonus
line: Selfless, until the end.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Envy that child, there's no need to... Already lived a grand life, your humanity has.

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "Heh... your praise puts my heart at ease, Grand Craftsman. Now..."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "...please take me through the last tempering that fate has to offer."

speaker: Phainon
line: The city is silent, and tension is building with every passing second.

speaker: Phainon
line: The news has probably spread by now. Every household is locked up tight... and all the market stalls have closed down temporarily.

text: She really was taken by the Cleaners...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I can't imagine, how she could've been taken down by a handful of assassins...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Unless it's all a part of her plan.

text: Something about this feels like a scheme...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I hope so...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I just can't believe she'd be taken down by a handful of assassins...

speaker: Phainon
line: If this is all part of a larger plan, Tribbie must know something. She just couldn't say it in the message.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go find her.

text: Why's the market look so emptied out?
As if anyone's keeping shop nowadays.
Could it be that they're infighting...
Shouldn't the holy city be safe?
The black tide's not the threat... it's the people...
Heroes... our hearts bleed with yours.
The murderer? The Council of Elders, obviously.

speaker: Phainon
line: Dan Heng came back before us.

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe he's heard something...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Ah, you're back. How's everything? No injuries, I hope?

speaker: Phainon
line: Don't worry. The Cleaners didn't lay a hand on us.

speaker: Phainon
line: Lord Krateros, were you in the city when it happened? What exactly went down...

speaker: Krateros
line: Regrettably, no one knows the details of that moment.

speaker: Krateros
line: Eyewitnesses only saw... um...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...It's fine. Just tell me.

speaker: Krateros
line: ...Eyewitnesses at the Marmoreal Palace saw Aglaea fall from the Chrysos Heir Bath.

speaker: Mem
line: Oh gods...

speaker: Krateros
line: She showed no signs of life by the time the Holy City Guards approached to check.

speaker: Krateros
line: They were too afraid to jump to conclusions... After all, she was a demigod who'd lived for over a thousand years, the leader of the Chrysos Heirs. Most citizens of this city believed that death couldn't touch her.

speaker: Krateros
line: She was pierced through the heart by a uniquely crafted dagger. I saw it for myself. It's one of the weapons carried by the "Cleaners."

text: Why didn't they go after us?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I also don't understand... This doesn't add up.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: No, that doesn't make sense...

speaker: Phainon
line: The ones who appeared in the Grove, and those who confronted Dan Heng in the Abyss, didn't immediately resort to violence. They were just watching and trying to intimidate.

speaker: Phainon
line: They didn't have any reason, nor the courage, to attack Aglaea. Perhaps...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Speculating blindly won't help. Let's go find Lady Tribbie, as she understands Aglaea's mind best.

speaker: Krateros
line: I'll stay here to lead the guards and maintain order. Find out what happened — but don't take too long. With Aglaea gone, someone has to take her place and lead Okhema.

speaker: Krateros
line: Also, Miss Hyacine was the one who declared Aglaea dead. You might want to speak with her.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Thank you, Lord Krateros.

speaker: Krateros
line: I'll stay here to lead the guards and maintain order. Find out what happened — but don't take too long. With Aglaea gone, someone has to take her place and lead Okhema.

speaker: Krateros
line: Also, Miss Hyacine was the one who declared Aglaea dead. You might want to speak with her.

text: Head to the Chrysos Heirs' bath

speaker: Phainon
line: The baths are empty...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: No citizen feels like bathing after hearing such terrible news.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hyacine.

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...You're back!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We heard from Krateros. Are you... alright?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'm fine... I've been staying close to Lady Tribbie and Lady Trinnon after the incident.

speaker: Hyacine
line: It's great that you could come back so quickly... They need someone with them now.

text: How are the two of them holding up?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Not well. After all, we witnessed Lady Aglaea's... last moments.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Yes... we witnessed her final moments.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I tried to treat her immediately, but even the sky's blessings...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Declaring her death was the hardest thing I've ever had to do as a doctor.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Phainon... don't push yourself. You're carrying a heavier burden now. Please don't fall...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...It's fine. I can handle it.

speaker: Phainon
line: What I've lost is a mentor, and comrade-in-arms. But for Tribbie and Trinnon, they've lost a thousand-year-old bond... like losing a part of their lives.

speaker: Phainon
line: You should rest, Hyacine. You've been awake for a long time, haven't you? We'll handle things from here.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Okay. See you later, everyone.

speaker: Phainon
line: Next... we should visit Lady Tribbie.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Snowy, Little Gray... you're back.

speaker: Phainon
line: Lady Tribbie, I...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Snowy, don't! Please don't apologize to us .

speaker: Tribbie
line: You went to the Grove to prepare yourself for the threats to Okhema. You didn't do anything wrong, so don't be hard on yourself.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We were always by Agy's side throughout this long journey, so we understood her thoughts better than anyone.

speaker: Tribbie
line: She knew she wouldn't see the end of the Flame-Chase Journey, yet she gave everything without hesitation... for the future of everyone.

speaker: Phainon
line: I know what Aglaea expected of me. Right now, the last thing Okhema needs is a leader wallowing in self-pity.

speaker: Tribbie
line: The scroll over there was entrusted to us by Agy. She instructed us to hand it over to you when the time was right.

speaker: Trinnon
line: I think... now's the "right time."

text: (Obtain a strand of Nameless Recollection forAs I've Written)

title: Step Description
content: Aglaea's final words gave Phainon resolve. He gathered everyone, determined to bring order to the chaos and calm the people. And indeed, he proved to be a gifted speaker.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Agy...

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: So, you... really don't have to take the medicine anymore?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: No need, teacher. Medicine can only steady my flesh, but it cannot stop the decay of my soul.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: I've already borrowed too much time from this world... And now, the time is up.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Now... is the best time for my exit.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: *sob*... *sniffle*...

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Please don't cry on my account, teacher...

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: I have... a final selfish request. Can you lend me an ear?

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: *sniffle* Agy...

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Go ahead... *sob* We will... definitely fulfill it for you.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: I wish for my death to be quiet and gentle. I hope that my lifeless body... will not be exposed to the eyes of the public.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Teacher, I have faced too many changes in my lifetime. But in the pursuit of one thing alone, I have remained unchanged for a thousand years...

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: ...It's "beauty," isn't it?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Huh...

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: That's right, teacher. "Beauty."

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Agy, do you think Snowy is... ready?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: A thousand years ago, when I took up the Coreflame of Mnestia... do you think I was ready then, teacher?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Born into this era, we had no choice but to grow amidst the raging waves, not set sail after everything was prepared.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Phainon — he will understand. He will grasp the duty I've left to him... He is mature enough now, no longer blinded by anger or hatred.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy...

speaker: Tribbie
line: I still remember the taste of that oatmeal...

speaker: Tribbie
line: See you tomorrow morning. I'll prepare breakfast for you then.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Phainon, my humble student, my trusted colleague —

speaker: Aglaea
line: As I write this, you are locked in a battle of words with the Council of Elders, fighting for the survival of the Flame-Chase Journey on a battlefield where the smoke of war is invisible.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ I deeply regret and feel guilty for hastily pushing you and (Trailblazer) into the debate. But please forgive me — at that moment, I could not afford to show any sign of weakness before you, as it would have crushed your morale.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I considered the debate a routine affair, assuming I could win merely with the support and experience we'd accumulated over centuries. But I underestimated Caenis and her party's cunning, and also the deterioration of my own senses.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The trap was likely set by the debater Callictis. He had prepared a severed golden thread in advance, revealing it to the public when Caenis was faltering in the debate.

speaker: Aglaea
line: He claimed I was reading everyone's thoughts with the golden thread to cheat in the debate. I could have countered that low tactic in a hundred ways, but my words slipped out before I could even think about them...

speaker: Aglaea
line: "With deceitful scoundrels like you in the crowd, I have no choice but to rely on the golden thread to keep watch over everything in this holy city."

speaker: Aglaea
line: You can imagine the reaction that comment provoked. At that moment, I felt my time was running short.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The divinity in this body might be eternal — but that is not the essence of "me." I am a daughter of humanity, born of my mother, and I will die as a human.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Realizing that my humanity was fading, I began to plan my exit. What kind of departure would not waste such a belated death? I have yet to find the ideal answer.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But I knew I couldn't simply fade away in my sleep like anyone else. The serpents have always lurked in the darkness, terrified of their heads being cut off by the golden thread.

speaker: Aglaea
line: If my departure were to be calm and uneventful, it would only lead to a swarm of serpents emerging from their nests. Regrettably, a peaceful death is a luxury I cannot afford.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I must feign weakness deliberately, to make those serpents lose patience and act rashly. Just as they think they've struck and sunk their fangs into my heels — that's when I'll strike back, igniting the final blaze to burn away the threats hidden in the shadows.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The blaze soaring into the sky might sow fear and confusion, but I have no worries about people losing their way. After all, Okhema still has you to guide them, Phainon.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You're not perfect, Phainon. I've witnessed your confusion, recklessness, and deep sensitivity dawn after dawn. The heavy burdens of your past have always weighed you down, inflicting deep pain.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Yet, in your way, you are perfect. You embrace everyone's imperfections, always ready to find the precious qualities hidden beneath their rough exteriors, unconditionally.

speaker: Aglaea
line: That might be what sets our sky father Kephale apart from other deities. They recognize the imperfections in their creations yet still choose to shine their light on them, offering protection with unconditional love...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Phainon, while you zealously pursued "Strife," believing it to be your destined path — from the very beginning, my thoughts have never changed.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You are the destined Worldbearer of Amphoreus, the gate to Amphoreus's future.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Go complete the Flame-Chase Journey of the prophecy. Ignite the stars and inspire hope in the hearts of humanity.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I will be waiting at the end of the west wind, looking forward to the miracle you will create.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea, how could I possibly be worthy... of the burning torch you've passed into my hands?

speaker: Phainon
line: Dan Heng, can you do me a favor?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Whatever I can help with, just say the word.

speaker: Phainon
line: Please deliver a message to Lord Krateros. Have him gather the Holy City Guards and the Kremnoans to spread the word from door to door: At the Lucid Hour tomorrow, Phainon will speak at the Marmoreal Palace.

speaker: Phainon
line: Urge everyone who has concerns about the holy city's future and the Flame-Chase Journey to attend this gathering. Tell them Aglaea has left Amphoreus the seeds of hope.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Understood.

speaker: Phainon
line: Thank you. It's been a harrowing day for everyone. Please make sure to rest well and collect your thoughts. I need to prepare...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Chartonus?

speaker: Phainon
line: What brings you to Marmoreal Palace?

speaker: Phainon
line: I planned to get everything settled before coming to see you. Is there something urgent, Chartonus?

speaker: Chartonus
line: How you're holding up, I wanted to see.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Better than I expected, you seem.

speaker: Phainon
line: There's no room for doubt anymore. It's time to take action and show everyone that the leadership of the Chrysos Heirs is still strong.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Right, your assessment is. Now, here, take this.

speaker: Phainon
line: Is this... You've completed it?

speaker: Chartonus
line: "Dawnmaker" — the name I've chosen for it.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Before Dawn, prepare for battle. For tomorrow, wield your sword. Befits your stature, it does, Chrysos Heir.

speaker: Phainon
line: "Dawnmaker"...

speaker: Phainon
line: Unbelievable. You've never seen that black-clad swordmaster... yet you've recreated this so precisely, just from what I described?

speaker: Chartonus
line: Precise, your description.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Imbued it with the power of Dawn, I already have. Guided by your will, gleam with golden flames, its blade will.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Wield it. May triumph always be yours.

speaker: Phainon
line: Thank you, Chartonus. I will use this sword to protect the beings of Amphoreus.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Another thing, there is...

speaker: Phainon
line: What's this...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Stored here, the remnants of Aglaea's divinity are.

speaker: Chartonus
line: This was her commission. Her death, she had long foreseen.

speaker: Phainon
line: Can she still hear us?

speaker: Chartonus
line: It's difficult to confirm. About divinity, we know very little.

speaker: Chartonus
line: In this way, she wanted to be with you, always.

speaker: Phainon
line: I understand. Let me keep it. With this... I'll have another constant companion by my side.

speaker: Phainon
line: "May this world never have need for a Deliverer." Someone told me long ago.

speaker: Phainon
line: But when the world dashed her hopes and fell into disarray, if she could see me now — leading from the front, rallying people against their destiny...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...She would surely smile.

speaker: Pessimistic Citizen
line: How will the holy city continue without Lady Goldweaver...

speaker: Uneasy Citizen
line: ...Look! Lord Phainon is here.

speaker: Hesitant Citizen
line: Will he step up to lead Okhema?

speaker: Phainon
line: Not long ago, I spoke at the citizens' assembly at Dawncloud.

speaker: Phainon
line: I wrestled with every word, searching for the right ones to rally support and keep the Chrysos Heirs' Flame-Chase alive.

speaker: Phainon
line: In the end, I remembered a lesson from one of my teachers: In battles where words are weapons, outrage and blind passion often overpower reason.

speaker: Phainon
line: I followed his strategy. I painted my opponents as nothing more than pests, tore apart their character, and laid out their crimes.

speaker: Phainon
line: The strategy worked. I secured enough votes to achieve my goal. But afterward? There wasn't even a flicker of joy.

speaker: Phainon
line: I realized — that apparent victory masked a deeper failure. In my pursuit of success, I fueled division and strayed far from the very purpose that led me to the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Phainon
line: This journey was supposed to unify, not divide. To strengthen us, not weaken us.

speaker: Phainon
line: It was the gold thread that mended our rifts in the past. Some saw it as a means of surveillance, a tool of control, but no one can deny that it was Aglaea who held this city, and even this shattered world, together.

speaker: Phainon
line: Now she is gone — yes, as you have heard — the demigod Aglaea, who guarded the holy city for a millennium, has indeed fallen.

speaker: Furious Citizen
line: Who murdered Lady Goldweaver?

speaker: Righteous Citizen
line: Find the murderer! Make them pay!

speaker: Phainon
line: I felt the same as all of you initially.

speaker: Phainon
line: I wanted to stand here beside you, to condemn the sinners, to discuss retribution, and to see justice brought down upon them...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...But my perspective has changed.

speaker: Phainon
line: The golden threads that once bound this city have unraveled, yet no one is celebrating their freedom from control. In the empty markets and bath chambers, one feeling lingers: Unease.

speaker: Phainon
line: Deep down, we all know — the last safeguard against the harm we may do to each other is gone. No divine power will protect us from the malice in our hearts. From now on, only the moral code we choose to uphold for ourselves will stand between us and the abyss.

speaker: Mem
line: Phainon has a way with words.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: ...Oh! Alright.

text: There's something special about a man of letters.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Indeed!

text: If it were me up there, I could do it too.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: ...You think highly of yourself, don't you?

speaker: Phainon
line: The Flame-Chase Journey is nearing its end, with only one Titan left for the Chrysos Heirs to conquer: Aquila .

speaker: Phainon
line: Before I rise to the skies, I challenge you — cast out the shadows and malice within your hearts. Let your spirits shine brighter than the sky itself!

speaker: Phainon
line: Let me bear witness: Even without the divine authority of Romance, Okhema will remain a sanctuary in these end times. A place for the kind people Aglaea dreamed of, the kind of people foretold in prophecy...

speaker: Phainon
line: A better people!

speaker: Spirited Citizen
line: ...Better people!

speaker: Inspired Citizens
line: Better people! Better people!

speaker: Okheman
line: Better people! Better people! Better people!

speaker: Phainon
line: I appreciate your willingness to accept the challenge... You have reminded me that Aglaea left me perhaps the simplest duty in the world.

speaker: Phainon
line: To bear the burden of creation, I need only to give one thing. It's a gift she once gave me without hesitation, and now I share it with each of you — unshakable faith.

speaker: Phainon
line: There's still a long way to go before Amphoreus is reborn. But we will not forget the past as we move forward, for the memories of Amphoreus will always benefit future generations.

speaker: Phainon
line: Allow me this moment. I want to borrow a few minutes of your time to commemorate a demigod who protected the holy city for a millennium...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...She was Okhema's dressmaster, the leader of the Chrysos Heirs, the Goldweaver Aglaea. And her greatest feat —

speaker: Phainon
line: — was being a selfless person.

speaker: Trianne
line: That singing sounds so familiar!

speaker: Trianne
line: That's our song, and Snowy used to love it!

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes, Lady Trianne. For that child filled with anxiety...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...your songs always dispelled the clouds in my heart, even if just for a moment.

speaker: Trianne
line: Hehe... Snowy was so cute and kind when he was little!

speaker: Trianne
line: Now... hmm, you've grown so much. Maybe not as cute but still just as kind!

speaker: Phainon
line: Hahaha... Time spares no one, so there's nothing we can do. But kindness... you helped nurture it in me.

speaker: Trianne
line: Don't mention it! Your light is as bright as ever. Keep it up and stay strong!

speaker: Trianne
line: See you, Snowy.

speaker: Phainon
line: Goodbye, Lady Trianne.

speaker: Anaxa
line: I heard what you said. Are you suggesting the debate tactics I've taught you are nothing but sleight of hand?

speaker: Phainon
line: Not at all, Professor Anaxa. Honestly, without those techniques you taught me, the Flame-Chase Journey might not have survived.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph... Good thing your head's still clear.

speaker: Anaxa
line: The Chrysos Heir of Kephale... I had no idea you had it in you while I was drilling those formulas into your head in class.

speaker: Phainon
line: Who could have thought, Professor? By the way, I've completely forgotten those formulas now.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Ha, some things never change. In our next lives, I'll teach you how to truly embrace your divine duties.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hahaha... I'll be waiting.

speaker: Phainon
line: Goodbye, Professor Anaxa.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Miss Castorice?

speaker: Phainon
line: Aren't you going to say something?

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Phainon, you... have always been so approachable.

speaker: Castorice
line: Ever since we first met, you've seen me as a friend... It was the first time I understood what everyday friendship was like.

speaker: Castorice
line: But that's... dangerous.

speaker: Phainon
line: Dangerous?

speaker: Castorice
line: Laughing and chatting with you, I sometimes forget who I am... and for someone with my kind of power, that's a real hazard.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ah... I hadn't thought of it that way. Sorry, I forgot to consider your perspective.

speaker: Castorice
line: Please, no apologies... Despite everything, thinking back on the times we spent together makes me really happy.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I feel the same.

speaker: Castorice
line: Goodbye, Phainon.

speaker: Phainon
line: Goodbye, Castorice.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Hehe...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Aglaea.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Remember, Phainon... after completing the Flame-Chase, leave the decision to initiate the Miracle of Genesis to the Amphoreans.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The Chrysos Heirs are the executors of the prophecy, yet they — the people are the true masters of this world.

speaker: Phainon
line: Rest assured. I always keep your teachings in mind.

speaker: Phainon
line: "The difference between a presumptuous hero and a tyrant is a fine line."

speaker: Aglaea
line: Well said. You've got a good memory.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's late... Anything else you'd like to add?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Anything else...?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Even in your imagination... I'm not one to show my vulnerable side.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ha... no worries. I've long understood how difficult it is for you to open up completely.

speaker: Phainon
line: Thank you for bringing me here, Aglaea... You saved me.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Heh... maybe what I wanted to save wasn't you, child...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...but this crumbling world.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Goodbye, Phainon.

speaker: Phainon
line: Goodbye, Aglaea.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph... Did you forget me?

speaker: Phainon
line: Ha, forget you? Like I'd ever.

speaker: Phainon
line: We aren't parting ways forever. You're just off to guard the gates at Castrum Kremnos. Let's not make this a tearful farewell.

speaker: Mydei
line: Heh... you know just how to make a person uncomfortable.

speaker: Mydei
line: I have a feeling we'll meet again in this lifetime. Let's have another showdown then, "Deliverer."

speaker: Phainon
line: That's very confident of you. I've changed since then. Have you seen this sword? It's a masterpiece, freshly forged by Chartonus.

speaker: Mydei
line: Ha... A bold statement for a mere mortal who hasn't yet claimed the power of a Titan.

speaker: Mydei
line: See you around, Phainon of Aedes Elysiae.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's a date, Mydeimos.
...What a poignant, yet splendid journey.
And it's still not over yet... is it?

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes, Cyrene.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Golden Thread, Relay the Savior's Fate 1.mp4

speaker: Cyrene
line: I was right. In the end, you did become the Deliverer in this story.

speaker: Phainon
line: A lot has changed while you were away. I've met so many people and tried so many things. I've found new resolve... and let go of some attachments.

speaker: Phainon
line: I'm not the same person I used to be.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Hee...

speaker: Cyrene
line: But to me —

speaker: Cyrene
line: You've never changed at all, Phainon.

speaker: Cipher
line: Ah, Dawncloud... This place holds so many different kinds of memories.

speaker: Cipher
line: I remember you could see the "Goldweaver" sign from here, all the way down the mountain.

speaker: Cipher
line: But my eyes aren't what they used to be a thousand years ago...

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Golden Thread, Relay the Savior's Fate 2.mp4

speaker: Aglaea
line: Cifera, you...

speaker: Cipher
line: Seamstress! Tell me!

speaker: Cipher
line: Does Okhema have any treasures so rare that not even your... I mean, our shop, has seen?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Of course, it has. I heard there's a "Gem of All Worlds" hidden somewhere in Dawncloud. Apparently it's a piece that fell out of the Dawn Device.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's truly a priceless treasure, being a part of Kephale's divine body. Even I, the Goldweaver, cannot witness its glamour.

speaker: Cipher
line: "Gem of All Worlds"...

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Chest, Bear the Bygone Dust 1.mp4

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Nice! Got it! Well, please keep looking after the shop while I—

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Let me guess, Cifera.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You're probably already plotting to sneak into Dawncloud to steal that gem, aren't you?

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Erm.

speaker: Aglaea
line: And your next move is probably trying to sell it to the highest bidder, then distribute that money to the poor and the refugees in the holy city.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Look, seamstress. Are you sure you aren't peeking into my head with your golden threads?

speaker: Aglaea
line: You might be skilled at covering up lies, but your compassion is all over your face, plain as day.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Don't lie to yourself. Do you honestly think this is the right thing to do, Cifera?

speaker: Cipher
line: ...What else am I supposed to do? That's the only thing I can do with my power!

speaker: Cipher
line: You keep talking about how I have the potential to become a good person, or even what people call a "hero"...

speaker: Cipher
line: But I don't know what I need to do to get there... I can't weave golden dresses like you, I can't sing as well as Miss Hysilens, and I definitely don't know as much as big sis Tribbie...

speaker: Cipher
line: The only things I'm good at are the underhanded street smarts that no one even respects!

speaker: Cipher
line: But... but I still want to be worthy of you. I want to prove that you've made the right choice. Even thieves can dream, right...?

speaker: Cipher
line: Tsk...

speaker: Aglaea
line: I know, Cifera... I know.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You are justified in your anger. Destiny is never fair, and your path is doomed to be even worse than everyone else's. You are fated to walk in the dark and bear the world's misunderstanding in this journey.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But you have to believe that everyone in this world is unique in their own way.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I am convinced that you're the only one who can bear the authority of Trickery, even if you have to contend with the legendary three hundred master thieves of Dolos.

speaker: Cipher
line: A–Aglaea...

speaker: Cipher
line: I just want everyone to believe that the world is beautiful and that everyone is simple and kind... If only I could get everyone to believe that...

speaker: Cipher
line: Would that lie become reality if enough people believed in it? ...Even though it's a lie?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Lies will always be lies, Cifera.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But sometimes... they can be more noble than the truth.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Are you really planning to just stand there forever? Honestly, sneaking around doesn't suit you, Deliverer.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ahaha... I never thought I could slip past your sharp ears, Miss Cipher. I just didn't think it'd be right to interrupt when you're obviously lost in thoughts.

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmph. Still as charming with your words as ever, boy. Your speech at the public baths wasn't half bad, I'll admit. It managed to touch my heart just a smidge.

speaker: Phainon
line: Thank you. I had a feeling back then that you were in the audience. Intuition certainly is a thing of wonder.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Oh? And you didn't call me out on the spot? You waited all this time to tell me?

speaker: Phainon
line: Well... I thought you'd need some time to yourself... after she passed away.

speaker: Cipher
line: Hm. None of your business.

speaker: Cipher
line: Enough small talk. Tell me, what kind of trouble did you run into that you need me, the super-old-timer, to step in?

speaker: Phainon
line: We've only met a couple of times, but you've always gone straight to business. I respect that about you, "old-timer," so I'll cut to the chase.

speaker: Phainon
line: You're probably aware that Aglaea has earned the support of the entire city for the Chrysos Heirs. Everyone believes that she died at the hands of Council members who are against the Flame-Chase, and the citizens' fury has been dragging these schemers out of the shadows one by one.

speaker: Phainon
line: But they didn't get everybody. To this day, we still haven't found Elder Caenis — the leader of the "Cleaners."

speaker: Cipher
line: Ah. I see. You're afraid she'll do something wild now that she's pushed into a corner, aren't you?

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes. I believe that Kephale's Coreflame, forever enshrined above the council theater, would be the opposition's final trump card against the Chrysos Heirs.

speaker: Phainon
line: We're setting out to campaign against Aquila in a few days. With the Chrysos Heirs gone, it'll be their best chance to strike...

speaker: Cipher
line: You think those desperate dogs will try to snatch the Coreflame while you're gone —

speaker: Cipher
line: — So you want me to give them a nice long walk while you're away, right?

speaker: Phainon
line: You sure saw right through me, Miss Cipher. I know exactly what you can do. God-like speed, perfect disguises, untraceable movements... And that most enigmatic authority of "Trickery."

speaker: Phainon
line: I have only one request. Please, use whatever tricks you need to protect Kephale's Coreflame, even if you have to deceive the rest of the Chrysos Heirs as well.

speaker: Cipher
line: Uh-huh...

speaker: Cipher
line: Hey, Deliverer. Do you honestly think that there's no way I'll turn you down?

speaker: Cipher
line: Do you even have any Plan Bs if I decide to nope out on this?

speaker: Phainon
line: As the demigod of Trickery, there are no other trump cards in the world that can out-rank you — I'm sure you know the answer to your own question, Miss Cipher.

speaker: Cipher
line: What confidence. You talk as if you have everything in the palm of your hand... Hmph, so you did learn a thing or two from her. I'll give you that.

speaker: Cipher
line: Then let me tell you something you don't know. The Flame Reaver — they've been watching Okhema closely.

speaker: Phainon
line: You mean...

speaker: Cipher
line: Bet you didn't expect that, huh? I've been tracking them all this time, and this is my conclusion.

speaker: Cipher
line: That lunatic may have lost their mind, but they're no fool. Why do you think they haven't made a move on Okhema yet?

speaker: Phainon
line: Professor Anaxa once analyzed this. He thought... It was probably because Kephale's Coreflame was protected by the Council of Elders' secret arts?

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha! Secret arts my foot. I could break those mechanisms with a flick of my finger.

speaker: Cipher
line: Allow me to let you in on the actual secret. They probably held off from attacking Okhema because the seamstress's defense network was way tougher than you thought.

speaker: Cipher
line: Now that she's gone... and you're heading out to the Eye of Twilight... with the city's defenses in shambles... tsk tsk tsk.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...What a dangerous situation we find ourselves in.

speaker: Phainon
line: But since you're the one who brought it up, I'm guessing that you already have a solution in mind.

speaker: Cipher
line: Just look how ridiculously calm you are right now...

speaker: Cipher
line: But you guessed it right. Consider this a two-for-one deal. I'll keep that lunatic entertained on top of protecting Kephale's Coreflame — You owe a big favor after this.

speaker: Phainon
line: You have my deepest gratitude. That Flame Reaver's power is truly unfathomable. Please be careful.

speaker: Cipher
line: Don't forget, Deliverer. There's a fundamental truth in this world. "Cifera will always get the last laugh." No need to worry about a demigod. I'll do my job, so you —

speaker: Cipher
line: Need to make sure that you don't die before you pay me.

text: To reach the heavens, one must first earn the sky's blessing...
